techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster

techs.name: Craftsmanship
techs.quote: Technology begins with with the making of the simplest things.

techs.name: Pottery
techs.quote: 'Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, what makest thou?' - Bible Isaiah 45:9

techs.name: Animal Husbandry
techs.quote: 'Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.' - Bible Deuteronomy 25:4

techs.name: Mining
techs.quote: 'The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.' - J. Paul Getty

techs.name: Fermentation
techs.quote: Fermentation is more than just a process; it's a cultural heritage passed down through generations.

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: The magic of the world often resides within its forgotten lore.

techs.name: Hunting
techs.quote: 'His seized his weapon, which the panther and lion fells in the night time cruelly. He captured the wild mountain goats. The panther he conquered.' - The Epic of Gilgamesh

techs.name: The Wheel
uniques: [+100]% weight to this choice for AI decisions
techs.quote: From the potter's wheel to the chariot wheel, this simple invention has shaped civilizations.

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: The weight of history rests upon the shoulders of well-laid stones.

techs.name: Metal Working
techs.quote: The skilled hand of the metalworker coaxes forth the hidden potential within the metal.

techs.name: Optics
techs.quote: 'It is a most beautiful instrument. There is no doubt that the telescope will reveal countless things.' - Johannes Kepler
